1.text: And Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,

2.text: How long wilt thou speak these things? and the words of thy mouth be a strong wind?

3.text: Doth God pervert judgment, and the Almighty pervert justice?

4.text: If thy children have sinned against him, he hath also given them over into the hand of their transgression.

5.text: If thou seek earnestly unto God, and make thy supplication to the Almighty,

6.text: If thou be pure and upright, surely now he will awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous;

7.text: And though thy beginning was small, yet thine end shall be very great.

8.text: For inquire, I pray thee, of the former generation, and attend to the researches of their fathers;

9.text: For we are [but] of yesterday, and know nothing, for our days upon earth are a shadow.

10.text: Shall not they teach thee, [and] tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

11.text: Doth the papyrus shoot up without mire? doth the reed-grass grow without water?

12.text: Whilst it is yet in its greenness [and] not cut down, it withereth before any [other] grass.

13.text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the profane man’s hope shall perish,

14.text: Whose confidence shall be cut off, and his reliance is a spider’s web.

15.text: He shall lean upon his house, and it shall not stand; he shall lay hold on it, but it shall not endure.

16.text: He is full of sap before the sun, and his sprout shooteth forth over his garden;

17.text: His roots are entwined about the stoneheap; he seeth the place of stones.

18.text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him: I have not seen thee!

19.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the dust shall others grow.

20.text: Behold, God will not cast off a perfect man, neither will he take evil-doers by the hand.

21.text: Whilst he would fill thy mouth with laughing and thy lips with shouting,

22.text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame, and the tent of the wicked be no more.
